fatalities.notes: Shot in the chest by settlers who were inside a car driving on Route 60 as he tried to escape them on a parallel road along with his father, who was also killed. The incident began when settlers, escorted by police, attacked the funeral procession of four Qusrah residents who were killed the day before, three of them, including one minor, in a settler attack and one by soldiers.

fatalities.name: Mus'ab 'Abd al-Halim 'Aref Abu Ridi
fatalities.notes: Shot in the back by settlers during clashes that broke out after the settlers attacked a home in the village with stones. During the clashes, the settlers threw stones and fired live rounds at the residents, who threw stones in an attempt to repel them. Settlers killed two more Palestinians in the incident, including a minor, and wounded a father and his five-year-old daughter. In clashes that broke out in the village afterwards, soldiers killed another Palestinian. At least 11 more Palestinians were injured that day.

fatalities.name: Mu'ad Raed Mahmoud 'Odeh
fatalities.notes: Shot in the back by settlers during clashes that broke out after the settlers attacked a home in the village with stones. During the clashes, the settlers threw stones and fired live rounds at the residents, who threw stones in an attempt to repel them. Settlers killed two more Palestinians in the incident, including a minor, and wounded a father and his five-year-old daughter. In clashes that broke out in the village afterwards, soldiers killed another Palestinian. At least 11 more Palestinians were injured that day.

fatalities.name: 'Obadah Saed 'Awad Abu Srur
fatalities.notes: Shot in the back by settlers during clashes that broke out after the settlers attacked a home in the village with stones. During the clashes, the settlers threw stones and fired live rounds at the residents, who threw stones in an attempt to repel them. Settlers killed two more Palestinians in the incident, including a minor, and wounded a father and his five-year-old daughter. In clashes that broke out in the village afterwards, soldiers killed another Palestinian. At least 11 more Palestinians were injured that day.

fatalities.name: Kamel Mahmoud Kamel Abu Baker
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by a Tel Aviv municipality security officer, after firing at him and his colleague, killing the colleague, during a street check. Israel is holding his body. Abu Baker was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

fatalities.name: Qusai Jamal Muhammad Mu'tan
fatalities.notes: Shot in the neck by settlers during clashes that erupted after the settlers invaded village lands.

fatalities.name: 'Abd al-Wahab 'Issa Hussein Khalaylah
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli civilian after running over and then stabbing passersby. According to media reports, Khalaylah injured eight Israeli civilians. He was shot at least two more times after being injured and falling to the ground. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: Muhannad Falah 'Abdallah Shihadah
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli civilian after he and another Hamas military wing operative shot and wounded the settlement security guard, and then fired at Israeli civilians, killing four, including a minor, and wounding three others. The other operative was fatally shot a short while later by Special Police Unit officers after a chase. Israel is holding Shihadah’s body.

fatalities.name: 'Alaa Khalil 'Ali Qeisiyah
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli settler after entering the settlement’s limits and, according to the military, approaching settlers holding a knife. Israel held his body until 8 July 2023.

fatalities.name: 'Abd al-Karim Badi'a 'Abd al-Karim Sheikh
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli settler after, according to the military, he entered the settlement armed with knives and explosive devices. Israel held his body until 4 May 2023.

fatalities.name: Mithqal Suliman 'Abd al-Halim Rayan
fatalities.notes: Shot in the head by a settler while throwing stones with other young men at settlers, some of whom were armed, who approached residents’ homes and attacked one of the residents.

fatalities.name: Karam 'Ali Ahmad Salman
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by settlement security guards when, according to the guards, he tried to enter the settlement. Israel held his body until 24 March 2023.

fatalities.name: Tareq 'Odeh Yusef M'aali
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli settler after trying to stab him in the agricultural outpost of Sde Efrayim. Israel held his body until 24 March 2023.

fatalities.name: Sanad Muhammad 'Othman Samamrah
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli settler near the outpost of Mitzpe Eshtamoa, while attacking another settler with a knife and, according to the media, moderately wounding him. Israel held his body until 3 April 2023.

fatalities.name: 'Udai Kamal Muhammad Musa Tamimi
fatalities.notes: Shot and killed by Ma’ale Adumim settlement security guards after he fired at them at the checkpoint at the entrance to the settlement and lightly wounded one of them. On 8 October 2022, Tamimi shot and killed a soldier at the Shu’fat R.C. checkpoint. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: 'Ali Hassan Yusef Harb
fatalities.notes: Stabbed in the chest by a settler who invaded his family’s land along with other settlers in order to set up a structure there. Soldiers, police and settlers delayed his evacuation for about 15 minutes.

fatalities.name: Mu'tasem Muhammad Taleb 'Atallah
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by a member of a settlement security squad after, according to the military, he entered the settlement’s territory holding a knife. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: Nidal Jum'ah 'Abdallah Ja'afrah
fatalities.notes: Shot by an Israeli civilian after, according to the military, he stabbed another Israeli civilian with a screwdriver, seriously injuring him, during a bus ride. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: Suliman 'Eid Yamin al-Hazalin
fatalities.notes: Critically wounded in his village by a tow truck the Israel Police was using to confiscate cars suspected of being unfit for use, after stones were thrown at it. According to the police, the truck driver sustained minor injuries. After hitting and injuring al-Hazalin, the tow truck dragged him along for nearly ten meters. Police officers and a soldier who were at the scene left after several minutes without providing al-Hazalin medical assistance or calling an ambulance. Since the injury, he has been lying in a coma in a hospital in Hebron.

fatalities.name: Khaled Maher Saleh Nofal
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot in the head and back by a settler and a settlement outpost security guard in circumstances unknown to B’Tselem. According to the military, he was unarmed. Israel held his body until 26 March 2021, when it was returned to his family.

fatalities.name: 'Ahed 'Abd a-Rahman Mahmoud Ekhlil
fatalities.notes: Wounded by a settlement security coordinator’s gunfire at Gush Etzion junction after, according to the military, he had thrown a knife during suspect apprehension procedure. Succumbed to his wounds shortly afterwards. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: Muhammad 'Abd al-Mun'im Muhammad 'Abd al-Fatah
fatalities.notes: Critically injured by shots that two Israeli settlers fired as he crouched between dumpsters by Route 60, after he threw stones at cars on the road. According to one of the shooters, ‘Abd al-Fatah had also tried to knife the settler’s daughter who was in a car. The two settlers continued firing at ‘Abd al-Fatah as he lay wounded on the ground. Media reports stated that he later died in hospital in Israel. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: Hamdi Taleb Sa'adah Na'asan
fatalities.notes: Hit in the back by settlers’ gunfire. He was with a group of village residents who were throwing stones at the settlers in an attempt to drive them off after the latter had come to the outskirts of the village and assaulted residents. Gunfire by the settlers injured another nine residents. Another villager was hit in the head by a rubber-coated metal bullet fired by Israeli security forces who arrived on the scene. Na’asan died of his injuries shortly after.

fatalities.name: 'Aishah Muhammad Talal Rabi
fatalities.notes: Killed by a stone thrown from the direction of the settlement Rechelim at the car she was riding in with her husband and daughter on Road 60.

fatalities.name: Muhammad Tareq Ibrahim Dar Yusef
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by a settler after he entered the settlement and stabbed three Israeli civilians; one was critically injured, succumbing to his wounds later that day. According to media reports the other two individuals sustained moderate and mild injuries. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: Muhammad 'Abd al-Karim Zuhdi Marshud
fatalities.notes: Hit by shots a settler fired. According to the police he was shot after trying to stab another Israeli civilian with a screwdriver near a gas station at the entrance to the Mishor Adumim Industrial Zone.

fatalities.name: Hamzah Yusef Muhammad Zama'arah
fatalities.notes: Shot and killed by a security guard of the settlement of Carmei Tzur after stabbing another security guard at the entrance to the settlement. According to media reports, the other guard sustained minor injuries. The autopsy performed on Zama’arah showed he had been shot in the stomach, chest and back.

fatalities.name: Mahmoud Ahmad Zaa'l 'Odeh
fatalities.notes: Shot in the torso by a settler while on his own farmland in the village.

fatalities.name: Mu'taz Hussein Hilal Bani Shamsah
fatalities.notes: Shot to death by a settler who drove into the town of Huwara and found himself in the middle of a demonstration. After his car was blocked by an ambulance, the settler ran over several demonstrators, and other demonstrators began kicking his car and throwing stones at him. Video footage aired by the media shows the settler shooting through the back window of his car, with a military jeep close by, the demonstrators at a distance, and no real threat to his life. The shooting injured a press photographer; according to media reports, he sustained moderate injuries.

fatalities.name: Sa'ed Muhammad 'Ali Qeisiyah
fatalities.notes: According to media reports, he was fatally shot by a settler after he entered the settler’s home and stabbed him, inflicting mild injuries.

fatalities.name: Wael Yusef 'Abd a-Rahim Abu Saleh
fatalities.notes: Shot and killed by an Israeli civilian near the market in Netanya after he stabbed and wounded two Israelis. According to a statement by the Israel Police Spokesperson, one Israeli sustained moderate to severe wounds and the other sustained minor wounds.

fatalities.name: Muhammad Naser Mahmoud Tarayrah
fatalities.notes: Shot and killed by members of Kiryat Arba’s security detail, after he went into a home in the settlement and stabbed a teenaged Israeli girl to death in her bed. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: 'Abd a-Rahman Mahmoud 'Abd a-Rahman Raddad
fatalities.notes: Stabbed dead by an Israeli civilian, after he stabbed the civilian. According to a statement by the Israel Police Spokesperson, the civilian sustained moderate wounds.

fatalities.name: Hussein Muhammad Hussein Abu Ghosh
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by the settlement guard after stabbing, together with another Palestinian, two women, Israeli civilians. The other assailant was also shot dead. One of the injured women died of her wounds the next day. According to media reports, the other woman sustained moderate injuries.

fatalities.name: Ibrahim Ousamah Yusef 'Allan
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by the settlement guard after stabbing, together with another Palestinian, two women, Israeli civilians. The other assailant was also shot dead. One of the injured women died of her wounds the next day. According to media reports, the second woman sustained moderate injuries.

fatalities.name: Ruqayah 'Eid Muhammad Abu 'Eid
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by the settlement security guard after she tried to stab him.

fatalities.name: Muhammad Zahran 'Abd al-Halim Zahran
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by a security guard in the industrial zone after he stabbed her and another guard. Media reports stated that the female security guard sustained moderate injuries and the male security guard sustained to moderate to grave injuries.

fatalities.name: 'Abd a-Rahman Yusri Zakaria Maswdeh
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by the settlement’s head of security after stabbing a soldier and an Israeli civilian. Media reports stated that the civilian sustained light injuries and the soldier sustained light to moderate injuries.

fatalities.name: Fadi Muhammad Mahmoud Khasib
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by an Israeli civilian. According to the Israel Police Spokesperson, he was shot after he ran over two people waiting at a hitchhiking station, causing them light injuries, then got out of his car and ran at them wielding a knife.

fatalities.name: Shadi Muhammad Mahmoud Khasib
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by an Israeli civilian. According to the Israel Police Spokesperson, he was shot after trying to run over people waiting at a hitchhiking station, after which he got out of his car and stabbed one of them, injuring him lightly.

fatalities.name: Muhammad 'Abed Musa Nimer
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by a Jerusalem Light Rail security guard while attempting to stab him.

fatalities.name: Fadel Muhammad 'Awad al-Qawasmi
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by an Israeli civilian. According to a statement by the IDF Spokesperson, he was shot while attempting to stab the civilian.

fatalities.name: 'Alaa Dawood 'Ali Abu Jamal
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by passersby after he ran over people waiting at a bus stop and then stabbed an Israeli civilian to death. According to media reports, another three Israeli civilians were also injured in the assault, two sustaining moderate wounds.

fatalities.name: 'Ali Sa'ed Muhammad Dawabsheh
fatalities.notes: Killed when his house was torched. His parents and brother were seriously wounded in the fire. His father died of his wounds on 8 August 2015 and his mother succumbed on 7 September 2015. Hate graffiti in Hebrew was spray painted near his home.

fatalities.name: Sa'ed Muhammad Hassan Dawabsheh
fatalities.notes: Fatally wounded when his house was torched. His 18-month-old son was burnt to death and his wife and young son seriously wounded. His wife died of her wounds on 7 September 2015. Hate graffiti in Hebrew was spray painted near his home.

fatalities.name: Riham Hussein Hassan Dawabsheh
fatalities.notes: Fatally wounded when her house was torched. Her 18-month-old son was burnt to death. Her husband was fatally wounded and died of his wounds on 8 August 2015. Another young son was seriously wounded. Hate graffiti in Hebrew was spray painted near her home.

fatalities.name: Khaled 'Azmi Khaled 'Odeh
fatalities.notes: Shot by a settler driving along the Huwarah road where a protest march against the military’s actions in Operation Protective Edge was under way.

fatalities.name: Muhammad Hussein Sa'id Abu Khdeir
fatalities.notes: Abducted by three Israeli citizens – two of them minors. They took him to the Jerusalem Forest, where they beat him and burned him to death.

fatalities.name: Husam Hussein Muhammad a-Rawidi
fatalities.notes: Stabbed to death in the center of Jerusalem by a youth who lived in the city.

fatalities.name: Yusef Fakhri Musa Ekhlil
fatalities.notes: Killed by a settler, who shot him on Safa village land.

fatalities.name: 'Udai Maher Hamzah Qadus
fatalities.notes: Killed by a settler’s gunfire at the edge of the village after he apparently threw stones at the shooter.

fatalities.name: Samer Mahmoud Ahmad Sarhan
fatalities.notes: Killed by a security guard in Silwan, East Jerusalem.

fatalities.name: Aysar Yasser Fawaz Zarraqah
fatalities.notes: A settler shot him after he threw stones at the settler’s car, which was travelling on Route 60.

fatalities.name: Rabah Hijazi Muhammad Sidr
fatalities.notes: Killed by gunshots fired by a member of the settlement’s security detail after entering the settlement of Beit Hagai, south of Kiryat Arba, armed with a knife and wounding another member of the detail in the leg.

fatalities.name: 'Alaa Hashem Hussein Abu Dheim
fatalities.notes: Killed when he entered Mercaz Harav Yeshiva and fired at the students.

fatalities.name: Muhammad Saleh Saber Shreiteh
fatalities.notes: Killed while throwing stones at a buys in a demonstration of youths.

fatalities.name: Muhammad Fathi Yunes Sabarneh
fatalities.notes: Killed by gunfire of teachers in a yeshiva after he entered the yeshiva area with another armed person and stabbed the instructors.

fatalities.name: Mahmoud Khalil 'Abd al-Fatah Sabarneh
fatalities.notes: Killed by gunfire of teachers in a yeshiva after he entered the yeshiva area with another armed person and stabbed the instructors.

fatalities.name: Taysir Yasser 'Abd al-Karim al-Karki
fatalities.notes: Taxi driver. Stabbed in the flat of his passenger, Julian Sophier, whom he had driven from Jerusalem. He had gone to the flat to get paid for the ride.

fatalities.name: Ahmad 'Ali Hassan Mansur
fatalities.notes: Killed in a shooting attack in the factory where he worked.

fatalities.name: Khalil Muhammad Ra'uf Saleh Wleiwel
fatalities.notes: Killed in a shooting attack in the factory where he worked.

fatalities.name: Ousamah Musa Ahmad 'Odeh Tawafshah
fatalities.notes: Killed in a shooting attack in the factory where he worked.

fatalities.name: Bassam Musa Ahmad 'Odeh Tawafshah
fatalities.notes: Killed in a shooting attack in the factory where he worked.

fatalities.name: Tareq Suliman 'Abdallah Yasin
fatalities.notes: Killed while carrying out a shooting attack. Two Israeli civilians were killed and three others were wounded in the attack

fatalities.name: Mahyoub Ahmad Nimer 'Asi
fatalities.notes: Killed by a Separation Barrier security guard, while he was in the family plot, about 200 meters away from a bulldozer parking lot.

fatalities.name: 'Alaa Muhammad 'Abd a-Rahman Khalil
fatalities.notes: Killed while throwing stones at an Israeli vehicle driven by private security guards the Separation Barrier.

fatalities.name: Salman Yusef Salman a-Safdi
fatalities.notes: Killed by a settler after he penetrated his house. He was not armed.

fatalities.name: Saeil Mustafa Ahmad Jbarah
fatalities.notes: Killed while driving his taxi, by a settler who wanted him to stop.

fatalities.name: Rayik Ma'sud Daraghmeh
fatalities.notes: Killed by the settlement security officer after he went into a field to relieve himself.

fatalities.name: Mahmoud Amin Mahmoud Hanani
fatalities.notes: Killed by settler gunfire while attempting to attack the settlement.

fatalities.name: Azher Ghassan Fawaz Hanani
fatalities.notes: Killed by a settler gunfire after trying to infiltrate the settlement when armed.

fatalities.name: Ahmad 'Abd a-Rahman Subuh
fatalities.notes: Killed when he went into a field to relieve himself.

fatalities.name: Tareq Abu Sneineh
fatalities.notes: Killed by settler gunfire after he fired at Nethaniel Ozeri, near Hebron.

fatalities.name: Hazem 'Adnan Fanun
fatalities.notes: Killed when guards returned fire at an unknown source.

fatalities.name: Isma'il Brreis 'Ashur
fatalities.notes: Killed by the settlement security officer after shooting two Israelis.

fatalities.name: Khaled Abu al-Iz
fatalities.notes: Killed by guards of the Trans-Israel Highway after he fired at men working on the highway.

fatalities.name: Hani Bani Maniyah
fatalities.notes: Shot and killed by settlers while harvesting his olives.

fatalities.name: Yusef Ibrahim Hassan 'Atallah
fatalities.notes: Killed by the security settlement unit after he infiltrated the settlement and wounded two people.

fatalities.name: Nivin Jamjum
fatalities.notes: Killed by gunfire when settlers rioted in Hebron.

fatalities.name: 'Adnan 'Odeh
fatalities.notes: Killed by gunfire when settlers rioted in Huwarra.

fatalities.name: Muhannad Mahmoud Abu Zor
fatalities.notes: Killed after entering a settlement and opening fire

fatalities.name: Habash Samir Abu a-So'ud Hanani
fatalities.notes: Shot and killed by an Israeli civilian after he entered the settlement of Itamar, opened fire and killed three Israeli civilians.

fatalities.name: 'Ali Idris Hamdan
fatalities.notes: Killed by the security officer after he penetrated the settlement and wounded the security officer in the neck.

fatalities.name: 'Issa Mahmoud Salim
fatalities.notes: Killed by gunfire from an ambush while riding in a truck near the settlement.

fatalities.name: 'Ata 'Abd al-Hai
fatalities.notes: Killed by gunfire from an ambush while riding in a truck near the settlement.

fatalities.name: Muhammad 'Awad
fatalities.notes: Killed by the settlement's security office after he infiltrated the settlement and killed a soldier.

fatalities.name: Muhammad Tawfiq 'Awadallah a-Shamali
fatalities.notes: Killed by settlers while attempting to commit a suicide attack in the Efrat settlement.

fatalities.name: Jamil Muhammad Abu 'Adwan
fatalities.notes: Killed by an Israeli civilian after firing at him and severely wounding him.

fatalities.name: Ibrahim Nabulsi
fatalities.notes: Killed by the security guard at a bank in East Jerusalem.

fatalities.name: Haydar Jadu' 'Abd al-Jabber Kan'an
fatalities.notes: Killed while riding in his car.

fatalities.name: Diaa' Marwan a-Tmeizi
fatalities.notes: Killed in a shooting attack by settlers when she was riding in her father's car.

fatalities.name: Muhammad Salamah a-Tmeizi
fatalities.notes: Killed in an attack by settlers while he was driving in his car.

fatalities.name: Muhammad Helmi a-Tmeizi
fatalities.notes: Killed in an attack by settlers while he was driving in his car.

fatalities.name: 'Awni 'Ali Hadad
fatalities.notes: Killed by Israelis who shot him while he was driving his truck with his family inside.

fatalities.name: Najib Muhammad Muhammad 'Abido
fatalities.notes: Killed after he infiltrated a settlement. He was shot by a settler when he tried to attack a police officer.

fatalities.name: Muhammad Hamed 'Ali Shalash
fatalities.notes: Killed by settler gunfire when throwing stones at their car.

fatalities.name: Muhammad Judah Abu 'Aasi
fatalities.notes: Killed by an Israeli civilian after he had stabbed his employer.

fatalities.name: Mustafa Mahmoud Musa 'Alian
fatalities.notes: Killed as a result of being hit in the chest by a rock when settlers threw stones at a car he was riding in.

fatalities.name: Farid Musa 'Issa a-Nesasreh
fatalities.notes: Killed by a settler from Itamar while harvesting olives near the settlement.

fatalities.name: Fahed Mustafa 'Odeh Baker
fatalities.notes: Killed by settlers who rioted in Biddya village.

fatalities.name: Muhammad 'Awadallah Muhammad Musa
fatalities.notes: Ambulance driver. Wounded by shots fired by soldiers or settlers while evacuating two villagers who had been wounded while defending homes from an attack by settlers escorted by a settlement guard and soldiers. After the wounded were put into the ambulance, Musa began driving, at which point shots were fired at him and he was wounded. A person escorting the wounded moved Musa aside, moved to the driver’s seat and drove to a medical center in a nearby village. Musa was pronounced dead at a hospital in Nablus.

fatalities.name: Jihad 'Afif Sidqi Abu 'Alia
fatalities.notes: Wounded in the head and died shortly after from shots fired by Israeli settlers or armed forces escorting them when they invaded the village while searching for a teenager from an outpost who was stabbed to death by a Palestinian and whose body was found the next day. Abu ‘Alia and others tried to repel the settlers, who attacked village homes with stone-throwing and gunfire, from the rooftop of one of the homes under attack. His evacuation was delayed as settlers fired near the home and Border Police officers attacked the men carrying his stretcher. Settlers attacked the village again the next day. During the two days of the attack, settlers and Israeli armed forces wounded dozens of residents. The settlers set fire to 12 homes and dozens of vehicles, stole 150 head of sheep, killing some of them, and destroyed dozens of olive trees

fatalities.name: Muhammad al-Hakim 'Issa 'Ali Zawahrah
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot with another Palestinian by Israeli civilians and police officers. The two were shot after firing at Israeli passengers near a-Za’ayem Checkpoint, killing one and wounding eight. His brother, who took part in the shooting, was wounded and arrested. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: Ahmad 'Azzam Ahmad al-Wahsh
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot with another Palestinian by Israeli civilians and police officers. The two were shot after firing at Israeli passengers near a-Za’ayem Checkpoint, killing one and wounding eight. Another shooter was wounded and arrested. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: Tawfiq Hafez 'Abd al-Jabbar 'Ijaq
fatalities.notes: Shot in the head by an off-duty Israel Police officer and an Israeli citizen while riding in his car with his friend, a minor, on his family's land near the village. According to the military, the shooting, carried out in the presence of a soldier, was prompted by suspicions that the minors threw stones at Route 60. B’Tselem’s investigation reveals that the two were shot as they were about to head back after an excursion on land owned by ‘Ajaq’s family and did not pose a threat to anyone. After the shooting, two military jeeps arrived at the scene, and then more shots were fired at ‘Ajaq’s car.

fatalities.name: Ahmad Mustafa 'Abed 'Asi
fatalities.notes: Shot in the back when soldiers and masked settlers chased village youths through the olive grove. The settlers invaded the village accompanied by soldiers, grazed their sheep there, set fire to two cars and burned down a house. Clashes developed between them and village residents, which included mutual stone throwing. Local residents discovered his body in a grove later. Three Palestinians were wounded by the gunfire.

fatalities.name: Muhammad 'Abd a-Rahman Hussein Fawaqa
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by settlers or soldiers from the direction of a caravan settlers placed on lands belonging to a village resident, while taking part in a security patrol undertaken by local residents due to settlers attack. The shots came from 400 meters away as the crow flies. The other patrol participant fled, and when residents tried to look for Fawaqa after the shooting, more shots were fired at them from the direction of the caravan.

fatalities.name: Hussein Mu'taz Hussein Musa
fatalities.notes: Shot in the head by soldiers or settlers a few meters away from the separation fence. His body was found in the area. His face was covered. Earlier that day, clashes broke out in the area between young men and soldiers. Settlers were also present.

fatalities.name: Suliman Farid Suliman Malasah
fatalities.notes: Shot in the back of the head by soldiers or settlers who came out of an ambush and fired at the car in which he was traveling with other youths towards the closed gate the military installed at the entrance to the village.

fatalities.name: Labib Muhammad Labib Dmeidi
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers or settlers while on the roof of his home with other relatives. The family members were throwing stones from the roof at settlers who were attacking their home along with soldiers.

fatalities.name: Ahmad Yasin Hilal Muhammad Ghizan
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by Israeli soldiers and civilian security guards after a chase. According to the military, he had fired at them from a car he was driving, killed a soldier and fled. Ghizan was a Hamas military wing operative. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: Sameh Hamdallah Mahmoud Aqtash
fatalities.notes: Shot in the abdomen by an unidentified Israeli party while trying, along with other residents, to repel settlers who entered the town and attacked homes with stones.

fatalities.name: Barakat Musa Yunes 'Odeh
fatalities.notes: Shot and severely wounded by a police officer and a civilian after hitting a bus stop near the settlement of Almog with his car. Footage posted on social media shows him being shot while still near his car and then again while lying on the ground. Earlier, ‘Odeh ran over five soldiers near a-Nabi Musa. According to the military, two of the soldiers suffered minor to moderate injuries, and three suffered minor injuries. ‘Odeh died of his wounds in an Israeli hospital later that day. Shot and severely wounded by a police officer and a civilian after hitting a bus stop near the settlement of Almog with his car. Footage posted on social media shows him being shot while still near his car and then again while lying on the ground. Earlier, ‘Odeh ran over five soldiers near a-Nabi Musa. According to the military, two of the soldiers suffered minor to moderate injuries, and three suffered minor injuries. ‘Odeh died of his wounds in an Israeli hospital later that day. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: Muhammad Kamel Ya'qub al-Ja'bari
fatalities.notes: Run over by the Kiryat Arba settlement security coordinator and shot by a soldier in civilian clothing at the Wadi al-Ghrus checkpoint, after shooting and wounding five settlers, one of whom died of his wounds shortly after. Another Palestinian was lightly wounded by the gunfire. Al-Ja’bari was a Hamas military wing operative. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: Amjad Nashaat Fahmi Naser
fatalities.notes: Wounded in the back by shots fired by a soldier or a settler as he was fleeing soldiers after throwing stones at them during a protest near Allon Road. Died of his wounds shortly after. Two other protestors were shot in the legs by soldiers and wounded.

fatalities.name: 'Omar Ibrahim Ayub Abu 'Asab
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli civilan and a Border Police officer on al-Wad (HaGai) Street in the Old City of Jerusalem after stabbing and wounding two police officers. According to media reports, one officer was wounded lightly and the other sustained medium-level injuries. B’Tselem’s investigation indicates that the officer shot Abu ‘Asab as he lay wounded on the ground after stabbing the officer again in the leg.

fatalities.name: 'Awad Ahmad 'Awad Harb
fatalities.notes: Shot in the abdomen, either by armed settlers who were invading village land or by soldiers who were escorting them, from dozens of meters away, while he was participating in mutual stone-throwing between the settlers and villagers. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later.

fatalities.name: Nidal Sayel Mustafa Safadi
fatalities.notes: Shot in the chest and abdomen by armed settlers who invaded the village land, or by soldiers who escorted them, while participating in mutual stone-throwing between the settlers and local residents.

fatalities.name: Isma'il Jamal 'Abd al-Majid Tubasi
fatalities.notes: Shot in the back of the head, either by settlers who had invaded village land and set fire to olive groves and fields or by soldiers who were escorting them, during clashes that developed between them and the villagers. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later.

fatalities.name: Nimer Mahmoud Ahmad Jamal
fatalities.notes: Shot in the head, arm and upper body by Border Police and the security coordinator of the Har Adar settlement after fatally shooting a Border Police officer and two security guards who were inspecting laborers at the entrance to the settlement. According to a statement issued by the police, the settlement’s security coordinator was also hit by the gunfire and sustained moderate to severe injuries.

fatalities.name: Muhammad Mahmoud Dawood Sharaf
fatalities.notes: Shot and killed by unknown Israelis after youths had thrown firecrackers at the settlement of Maale HaZeitim in East Jerusalem. The findings of B’Tselem’s research raise concern that the shots were fired by a settler or by the settlement’s security guard.

fatalities.name: Fadi Ahmad Hamdan al-Qunbar
fatalities.notes: Member of the military wing of the Popular Resistance Committee. Shot and killed by soldiers and an Israeli civilian at the Armon Hanatziv Promenade , after he ran over and killed four soldiers, and – according to a statement by the Israel Police – injured 13 other soldiers. Israel is holding his body.

fatalities.name: 'Abd al-Muhsen Shaher 'Abd al-Muhsen Hasunah
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by a member of the security forces, a security guard and an Israeli civilian after he ran over people waiting at a bus station. Media reports stated that twelve people were hit by the vehicle, ten of them sustaining light injuries and the other two moderate injuries.

fatalities.name: Ahmad Hamadah Yunes Qneibi
fatalities.notes: Critically injured by gunshots fired by Border Police officers, light rail security guards and passersby, near the light rail station at Ammunition Hill, after stabbing a U.S. citizen. Later died of his wounds in hospital. According to media reports, the American civilian sustained moderate injuries. An Israeli civilian was also hit when shots were fired at Qneibi.

fatalities.name: Milad Sa'id 'Ali 'Ayash
fatalities.notes: Critically wounded by gunfire from the one-building settlement of Beit Yehonatan in the neighborhood of Silwan, East Jerusalem, during clashes in which stones and Molotov cocktails were thrown at the building. The identity of the shooter remains unknown, and DIP and police investigations as to the possible involvement of police officers, settlement security guards or local settlers were closed on the grounds of “perpetrator unknown”.

fatalities.name: Mar'i Ahmad Mahmoud a-Radaydeh
fatalities.notes: Critically injured when he was shot by police and a civilian after driving a tractor into a police car. According to media reports, the two policemen who were in the police car sustained mild injuries.

fatalities.name: Hanan 'Abd a-Rahman Kayed Abu Salameh
fatalities.notes: Shot and wounded in the chest while harvesting olives with family members on their land, about 200 meters away from the separation fence. The soldiers stopped their vehicle on the “security road” adjacent to the fence, and a soldier who got out of it fired at the family members without warning. About two hours earlier, a soldier fired into the air from the "security road" while the family were harvesting in a plot closer to the fence, which was why they moved to the plot where Abu Salameh was shot. Her family members transported her in a car to an ambulance that took her to the hospital, where she was pronounced dead.

fatalities.name: Saja Naser Muhammad Khreiwish
fatalities.notes: Killed with her husband and their two minor children in their apartment when missiles fired from an aircraft hit their three-story residential building. The missile was fired as part of a targeted killing in which all 18 Palestinians in the building were killed, including her brother and another minor. The other 14 casualties, including a minor, were killed in a café on the ground floor of the building. According to the military, Palestinian operatives of armed groups who were in the café were planning an attack on Israeli civilians.

fatalities.name: Zuhour Qassem 'Abd a-Rahim 'Amur
fatalities.notes: Shot in the arm and back by soldiers while sitting with other women in her relatives’ yard during a condolence visit. The soldiers surrounded a house and arrested a resident in an elevated area of the village, then fired from there towards the yard. Two minors were wounded in the shooting, one of them a resident of the house, as well as an elderly woman. The injured were taken to a medical center in a nearby village, where ‘Amur was pronounced dead.

fatalities.name: Hibat Allah Shihadah Musleh 'Obeid
fatalities.notes: Wounded by shots fired by Israeli soldiers or Border Police officers when she stepped out with her mother to see what the commotion outside was about, during a raid of the refugee camp by Israeli forces. The Israeli forces also shot and wounded a paramedic who tried to evacuate her. She was pronounced dead at the hospital. During the raid, which lasted about two days, the Israeli armed forces killed four more Palestinians.

fatalities.name: Bayan Muhammad Jum'ah Salem 'Obeid
fatalities.notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft along with her mother and three armed Palestinians, who were near them on the street, during a raid by military, Border Police and Shin Bet personnel. The three men were the target of a military assassination. During the raid, a fire exchange between Israeli forces and Palestinian operatives took place elsewhere in the camp. One operative was killed by Israeli forces’ gunfire. A video posted on social media shows a military bulldozer taking the bodies of four of the dead away. Israel is holding her body.

fatalities.name: Iman 'Abdallah Salem 'Obeid
fatalities.notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft along with her daughter and three armed Palestinians, who were near them on the street, during a raid by military, Border Police and Shin Bet personnel. The three men were the target of a military assassination. A’beid was killed minutes after taking a photo holding one of the armed men’s firearms. During the raid, a fire exchange between Israeli forces and Palestinian operatives took place elsewhere in the camp. One operative was killed by Israeli forces’ gunfire. A video posted on social media shows a military bulldozer taking the bodies of four of the dead away.

fatalities.name: Nisrin Khaled 'Ali Damiri
fatalities.notes: Killed when a missile fired from an aircraft hit the tin roof of her kitchen, while she was sitting in the living room with her sister-in-law, who was wounded. The missile was fired while armed Palestinians were shooting at Israeli forces as they retreated after a raid of nearby Nur Shams Refugee Camp, where they destroyed infrastructure. A soldier was killed by an IED explosion at the beginning of the raid. During their retreat, the Israeli forces fatally shot a minor who was standing on a street in the city.

fatalities.name: Maymunah 'Abd al-Hamid Muhammad Harahshah
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by Israeli soldiers at a military post on Route 60, according to the military, after attempting to stab one of them. Israel is holding her body.

fatalities.name: Labibah Faze' Sidqi 'Alian
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers at a checkpoint, according to the military, after attempting to stab one of them. Israel is holding her body.

fatalities.name: 'Ahd Mahmoud Yusef Awlad Muhammad
fatalities.notes: Shot in the head by soldiers while standing on her rooftop, calling out to her husband, who was in the street while Palestinians threw stones and Molotov cocktails at soldiers and Border Police officers in clashes that developed after the Israeli forces entered the town and arrested Palestinians. During the clashes, another Palestinian was killed and at least 10 were wounded by the forces’ fire. The forces also used a town resident as a human shield.

fatalities.name: Duha Nabih 'Abd a-Rahman Abu 'Eid
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot along with her husband by Border Police officers, after the husband broke through a checkpoint in their car and ran over a police officer, lightly injuring her. A four-year-old girl who arrived at the checkpoint in a shared taxi with her mother and three siblings was also killed by the officers’ gunfire. Israel held her body until 29 February 2024.

fatalities.name: Rihab Mustafa Muhammad Yosef
fatalities.notes: A cancer patient who was wounded by fragments inside an ambulance that was taking her home from the hospital, during clashes in which a minor who threw stones and tried to throw an improvised explosive device at military jeeps near the hospital was fatally shot. That day, four more Palestinians, a minor and three armed operatives, were struck by a missile fired from an aircraft and either killed or wounded and died of their wounds later. In the remaining two days of the invasion, six more Palestinians were killed, all operatives of armed groups, two of them minors. Dozens of Palestinians were arrested.

fatalities.name: Randah 'Abdallah 'Abd al-'Aziz 'Ajaj
fatalities.notes: Shot in the abdomen by soldiers at a flying checkpoint while riding in a car with her husband, their two sons, an infant and an 18-year-old. A B'Tselem investigation disproved the military's claim that the incident involved an attempted car attack. The investigation revealed that the father saw soldiers, apparently wearing civilian clothes, suspected they were settlers, panicked, sped up and tried to escape. The soldiers fired at least two bullets at the car, killing the mother and wounding the elder son.

fatalities.name: Mirvat Saleh Muhammad Khaswan
fatalities.notes: Killed together with her husband and son when a missile struck her home and the home of her neighbor, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, who was killed together with his son and daughter, both minors. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

fatalities.name: Daniyah 'Alaa 'Ata 'Adas
fatalities.notes: Killed together with her sister, a minor, in their home, when a missile struck their building. A senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, his wife and his minor daughter were also killed in the strike. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

fatalities.name: Layla Majdi Mustafa al-Bahtini
fatalities.notes: Killed together with her daughter, a minor, and her husband, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, when a missile struck their home. Two sisters living in the same building, one of them a minor, were also killed in the strike. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

fatalities.name: Wafaa Nimer Tawfiq Ghanam
fatalities.notes: Killed together with her husband, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, when a missile struck their home.

fatalities.name: Iman Ziad Ahmad 'Odeh
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers, according to the military, after she attacked one of them with a knife, causing a minor injury.

fatalities.name: Majedah 'Abd al-Fatah Mahmoud 'Obeid
fatalities.notes: Shot in the neck and chest by Israeli forces while in her home, during an exchange of fire that developed between armed Palestinians and the forces upon their entry into the camp. Eight more Palestinians, including two minors, three Islamic Jihad military wing operatives and an al-Aqsa Martyrs’ Brigade operative, were killed in the incident, and 20 were injured. One of the injured men, an Islamic Jihad military wing operative died of his wounds on 29 January 2023.

fatalities.name: Hanaa Isma'il 'Ali Dweik
fatalities.notes: Killed at home along with her son when guided bombs hit their building, also killing three senior Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, another building resident and a minor living in a nearby building. Additionally, 51 Palestinians, including 23 minors and 14 women, were wounded in the attack.

fatalities.name: Alaa Saleh 'Abd al-Muhsen al-Mallahi
fatalities.notes: Killed at home when guided bombs hit her building, killing three senior Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, another building resident and her son, and a minor living in a nearby building. Additionally, 51 Palestinians, including 23 minors and 14 women, were wounded in the attack.

fatalities.name: Duniana 'Adnan 'Atiyyah al-'Amur
fatalities.notes: Wounded in the head and chest from a tank shell while at home, about one kilometer away from the Gaza perimeter fence. Her mother and sister were wounded in the attack. Died of her wounds shortly after.

fatalities.name: Ghufran Harun Hamed Warasnah
fatalities.notes: Journalist. Seriously wounded in the chest by soldiers’ gunfire after, according to the military, she approached them holding a knife. Died of her wounds a short while later.

fatalities.name: Shireen Nasri Anton Abu Akleh
fatalities.notes: Journalist. Fatally shot in the head during a military incursion into a nearby refugee camp. Investigations conducted by global media and B’Tselem determined that all the findings indicated that the gunfire was issued by the military from a spot where military vehicles were standing, about 200 meters away. Another journalist was hit in the shoulder by the gunfire, and additional shots were fired at a Palestinian who tried to evacuate her from the scene.

fatalities.name: Ghadah Ibrahim 'Ali Hassan
fatalities.notes: Wounded in the thigh by the gunfire of soldiers standing at a checkpoint in the village, after she approached them with her hands raised. Died of her wounds a short while later.

fatalities.name: Maha Kazem 'Awad a-Za'tari
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by Border Police officers after, according to the police, she stabbed a Border Police officer, lightly injuring him. Israel held her body until 23 December 2022.

fatalities.name: Hanan Mahmoud 'Abd a-Ra'uf Khaddur
fatalities.notes: Wounded in the abdomen by soldiers’ gunfire while traveling in a shared taxi, during clashes that broke out in the city shortly after the killing of an Islamic Jihad military wing operative in the nearby refugee camp.

fatalities.name: Israa Khaled 'Aref Khzeimiyyah
fatalities.notes: Wounded by Israel Police and Border Police officers’ gunfire near Bab a-Silsila, one of the entrances to the al-Aqsa compound, after, according to the police, she tried to stab them. Succumbed to her wounds a short while later. Israel held her body until 19 November 2021.

fatalities.name: Mai Khaled Yusef 'Afanah
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers after she tried to run them over and, according to the military, got out of the car brandishing a knife. Israel held her body until 23 August 2022.

fatalities.name: Ibtesam Khaled Saleh Ka'abneh
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by a security guard at Qalandiya Checkpoint after, according to the police, advancing towards security guards and Border Police officers while brandishing a knife. Israel held her body until 23 July 2021.

fatalities.name: Huda Salah Rabi' al-Khazandar
fatalities.notes: Killed at her home, which was hit in an attack on a neighbors’ house. Her husband, son, and 10 other people were injured in the incident.

fatalities.name: Wafa 'Abd a-Rahman 'Abd a-Razeq Barad'i
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers after opening fire at soldiers and civilians at the entrance to a settlement. In video footage posted on social media, gunfire is heard lasting after Barad’i is already lying wounded on the ground. Israel is holding her body.

fatalities.name: Sa'diyah Yusef Taher al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
fatalities.notes: Killed with her husband, son, daughter, two daughters-in-law, six of their grandchildren, including two minors, their grandson's wife and their four-month-old great-grandson, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Bahaa Amin Muhammad al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
fatalities.notes: Killed with her parents, brother, two sisters-in-law, six of her nephews, two of them minors, her nephew's wife and the four-month-old son of one of the nephews, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: 'Abir Nimer 'Ali Ishkuntana
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her four children, between the ages of two and nine, in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family in which 17 other people were killed, including six minors. In addition, 22 members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family were killed, six of them minors including a four-month-old baby, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Two other people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Du'aa 'Omar 'Abdallah al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
fatalities.notes: Killed with her husband, two of their children, both of them minors, her brother-in-law and three of their children, all minors, and 14 other people from her husband's extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Amal Jamil Salamah al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
fatalities.notes: Killed with three of her children, two of them minors, her in-laws, her brother-in-law and sister-in-law, and 14 other people from her extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Ayat Ibrahim Khalil al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
fatalities.notes: Killed with her husband, their four-month-old son, and 19 other people from her husband's extended family, including six minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Riham Fawaz Amin al-Kolak
fatalities.notes: Killed with her father, grandparents, two brothers, a sister-in-law and her four-month-old son, two aunts, her uncle's wife and three of her children, two of them minors, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Khitam Musa Hashem al-Kolak
fatalities.notes: Killed with her in-laws and 19 other people from their extended family, including eight minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Rawan 'Alaa Subhi Abu al-'Oaf
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her parents and sister, seven other people from her extended family, and 12 other occupants, including nine minors, in a residential building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Rim Ahmad Khalil Abu al-'Oaf
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her husband, two of her children, her in-laws, four other people from her husband's extended family and 12 other occupants, including eight minors, in a residential building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Subhiya Isma'il Hussein Abu al-'Oaf
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with nine members of her extended family and 12 other occupants, including 10 minors, in a residential building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Shaimaa 'Alaa Subhi Abu al-'Oaf
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her mother and sister, seven other members of her extended family and 12 other occupants, including 10 minors, in a building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Majdiyah Khalil Hussein Abu al-'Oaf
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her husband, their son, their daughter-in-law and two of their grandchildren, both minors, as well as four people from their extended family and 12 other occupants, including eight minors, in a building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Rajaa Subhi Isma'il al-Ifranji
fatalities.notes: Killed with her four children, all minors, while visiting relatives in a building owned by the extended family, in which 17 other people, including six minors, were killed. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Diana Ziad Muhyi a-Din Abu al-'Oaf (al-Yazji)
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her two daughters, seven members of her husband's extended family and 12 other occupants, including 10 minors, in a building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

fatalities.name: Yasmin Muhammad Khamis Abu Hatab
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with four of her children, all minors, and her sister-in-law and four of her children, all minors, who were staying with them. The house was completely destroyed and five nearby houses were partially destroyed. Yasmin's husband, 'Alaa Abu Hatab, is a Hamas military wing operative, but it is unkown whether he was the target of the attack.

fatalities.name: Maha Muhammad 'Abd al-'Aal al-Hadidi
fatalities.notes: Killed with four of her children, all minors, as well as her sister-in-law and four of her children, all minors, in an airstrike on the home of her sister-in-law and her brother, 'Alaa Abu Khatab, a Hamas military wing operative, where she was staying with her five children.

fatalities.name: Lamyaa Hassan Muhammad al-'Attar
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her three young children, including a nine-month-old baby. Her husband and 13 other occupants of the building were injured. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network passed by the house.

fatalities.name: Fayzah Ahmad Muhammad Salamah
fatalities.notes: Killed at home. Her husband and son were injured. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network passed by the house.

fatalities.name: Halimah 'Ali Muhammad al-Madhun
fatalities.notes: Killed at home along with her husband in an airstrike on nine homes near a-Sheikh Zayed Square. The bombing also killed six members of the a-Tanani family - the father, the pregnant mother, and their four children, who were minors - as they were trying to flee their home. A Hamas military wing operative who lived nearby was not home at the time of the attack.

fatalities.name: Rawyah Fathi Hassan a-Tanani
fatalities.notes: Killed while three months pregnant, along with her husband and their four children, who were minors, as they were trying to flee their home during an airstrike on nine homes near a-Sheikh Zayed Square. A Hamas military wing operative who lived nearby was not home at the time of the attack.

fatalities.name: Nisrin Naser Muhammad Abu Fares
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her two sisters and her infant nephew. Another neighbor was killed at home, as well as a neighbor who was standing in his doorway.

fatalities.name: Ni'mah Saleh Salamah 'Ayash
fatalities.notes: Killed at home by shelling of the Abu Fares family home nearby. Three sisters and an infant from the Abu Fares family were killed, as well as another neighbor who standing in his doorway.

fatalities.name: Sabrin Naser Muhammad Abu Fares (Abu Diyah)
fatalities.notes: Killed with her infant son and her two sisters in their father's house. A neighbor who was at home and another neighbor who was standing in his doorway were also killed in the attack.

fatalities.name: Manar Khader Ahmad 'Issa
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her daughter, a minor. Her husband and other people were injured.

fatalities.name: Siham Yusef Mahmoud a-Rantisi
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her son, a Hamas military wing operative, with her daughter-in-law and with her infant grandson, in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building.

fatalities.name: Shaimaa Diab Muhammad a-Rantisi
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her husband, a Hamas military wing operative, with her mother-in-law and with her infant nephew, in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building.

fatalities.name: Khulud Fouad Farhan a-Zamli
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her infant daughter, in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building. Nine members of the family were injured.

fatalities.name: Hadil Muhammad Ibrahim Aman
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her father and two of her sisters, one of whom was six months pregnant. Her mother, her two brothers and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

fatalities.name: Walaa Muhammad Ibrahim Aman
fatalities.notes: Killed in her parents' home with her father and two of her sisters while six months pregnant. Her mother, her two brothers and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

fatalities.name: Warda Muhammad Ibrahim Aman
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her father and two of her sisters, one of whom was six months pregnant. Her mother, her two brothers and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

fatalities.name: Mayami 'Abdallah Musa 'Arafah
fatalities.notes: Killed at home along with her daughter. Three members of the family were injured.

fatalities.name: Hadil Khaled Mahmoud 'Arafah
fatalities.notes: Killed at home along with her mother. Three members of the family were injured.

fatalities.name: Maysoun Zaki Hashem al-Hittu
fatalities.notes: Killed along with her husband and a taxi driver who was driving the couple and their son to their daughters' house. In the attack, three other Palestinians were killed on the street, one by his house, and two by a sewing workshop belonging to one of them. Two of her children were injured, and another Palestinian on the street was severely injured.

fatalities.name: Rima Sa'ed Kamel a-Talbani
fatalities.notes: Killed at home along with her son and daughter, both minors, in an airstrike on their building. Her husband was severely injured in the attack. Two senior Hamas military wing operatives who were in the building, as well as a minor who was in a nearby building, were killed. Her daughter's body was extracted about nine days after the attack.

fatalities.name: Amirah 'Abd al-Fatah 'Abd a-Rahman Subuh
fatalities.notes: Killed along with her son, who had cerebral palsy, when a missile hit their sixth-floor apartment. Two other Palestinians were injured in the attack, one of them severely.

fatalities.name: Layali Taha A'bbas Sharir
fatalities.notes: Killed along with her 15-year-old daughter and her husband, a senior Hamas military wing operative, in an attack on their two-story building, which collapsed. Her toddler daughter was injured in the strike and succumbed to her wounds about a week later.

fatalities.name: Fahmiyah (Rihab) Muhammad Musa al-Hrub
fatalities.notes: Critically wounded in the legs and abdomen by soldiers’ gunfire from several meters away, as she was advancing slowly towards them brandishing a knife. Succumbed to her wounds later that day.

fatalities.name: Yusra Muhammad 'Awwad a-Sawarkah
fatalities.notes: Killed when the family homes were bombed along with two of her minor children. Her husband, who was wounded, died of his wounds on 22 November 2019. Her brother-in-law, his wife and three of their minor children, two of them toddlers, were also killed in the attack, and 8 other people, 7 of them minors, were wounded

fatalities.name: Maryam Salem Naser a-Sawarkah
fatalities.notes: Killed when the family homes were bombed along with her husband, their two toddlers, and her husband’s son from a previous marriage. Her brother-in-law, who was wounded in the attack, died of his wounds on 22 November 2019. His wife and their two minor children were also killed and eight other people, seven of them minors, were wounded.

fatalities.name: Asmaa Muhammad Hassan Abu al-'Ata
fatalities.notes: Killed when her house was bombed. Her husband, a senior operative in the military wing of the Islamic Jihad was also killed in the attack, and four of their children were wounded, two of them minors, along with three other people.

fatalities.name: Nayfeh Muhammad 'Ali Ka'abneh
fatalities.notes: Hit by security guards’ gunfire after she approached them carrying a knife. Video footage of the incident posted on social media shows one of the guards firing at Ka’abneh from about 10 meters away. B’Tselem’s investigation found that she was not given any medical care for about half an hour. Ka’abneh was then taken to hospital where she was pronounced dead shortly after.

fatalities.name: Amani 'Atfat Sha'ban al-Madhun
fatalities.notes: Was heavily pregnant. Killed by shrapnel in an airstrike on her family’s home as was her brother-in-law, an Islamic Jihad military branch operative. Also injured in the airstrike were her father-in-law and a neighbor, both of whom succumbed to their wounds shortly after, and six minors.

fatalities.name: Iman 'Abdallah Musa Asraf (al-Ghazali)
fatalities.notes: Officer in the Hamas regime police. Killed together with her husband, three-month-old daughter, and three members of the Abu al-Jidyan family, one a minor, when their apartments, which border one another, were bombed in the a-Sheikh Zayed Tower.

fatalities.name: Raghdah Muhammad Mahmoud Abu al-Jidyan
fatalities.notes: Killed together with her husband, son (a minor), and three members of the al-Ghazali family, including a three-month-old baby girl, when their apartments, which border one another, were bombed in the a-Sheikh Zayed Tower. Her body and that of her husband were located only the day after the bombing.

fatalities.name: Amal Mustafa Ahmad a-Taramsi
fatalities.notes: Died of her wounds shortly after being hit in the neck by Israeli security forces' gunfire while about 200 meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence during the Return Protests near the fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. During the demonstration, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones, explosive devices and improvised grenades at Israeli security forces who were stationed on the other side of the fence.

fatalities.name: Inas Suliman Ahmad Abu Khamash
fatalities.notes: In the advanced stages of pregnancy. Killed with her toddler daughter while they were asleep at home, by a bomb that penetrated their home without exploding. Her husband was injured.

fatalities.name: Ruzan Ashraf 'Abd al-Qader a-Najar
fatalities.notes: Paramedic. Shot in the chest by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town of Khuza’ah; thousands took part in the protests. During the demonstration, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. B’Tselem’s investigation found that a-Najar was shot about 25 meters from the fence and some 10 meters from the demonstrators, while wearing a medic’s uniform.

fatalities.name: Siham Rateb Rashid Nimer
fatalities.notes: Fatally shot at Damascus Gate by Border Police officers after she brandished a pair of scissors at them; there was a metal police barrier between her and the officers.

fatalities.name: Rahiq Shaji' Muhammad Yusef
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by Border Police at Za'tara (Tapuach) Junction. According to the police, she was shot after she approached the officers brandishing a knife. Video footage broadcast by the media shows police firing some 30 bullets at her as she lay wounded on the ground, posing no danger to anyone.

fatalities.name: Sarah Dawood 'Ata Hajuj
fatalities.notes: Shot and killed by a Border Police officer who was standing at the entrance to a small room where Hajuj was being held. B’Tselem’s inquiry indicates that she had apparently pulled out a knife, and the officers in the room pepper-sprayed her in the face and fled from the room. The shots were fired after Hajuj was alone in the room and posed no danger to anyone.

fatalities.name: al-Majd 'Abdallah 'Abdallah al-Khadur
fatalities.notes: Shot and killed by soldiers after deliberately ramming her car into another car that was at a hitchhiking station at the entrance to Kiryat Arba.

fatalities.name: Ansar Husam Hifzi Harshah
fatalities.notes: Shot and killed by soldiers at ‘Anabta Checkpoint. She had arrived at the checkpoint armed with a knife. Shot when she no longer posed a danger.

fatalities.name: Sawsan 'Ali Dawood Mansur
fatalities.notes: Shot dead at the Bidu checkpoint. According to a statement by the Israel Police Spokesperson, she was shot when she approached the checkpoint, knife in hand, and did not heed calls by the police to halt

fatalities.name: Zanah 'Atiyyah Muhammad al-'Amur
fatalities.notes: Killed by a tank shell, while working in an agricultural field about half a kilometer from the perimeter fence. According to media reports, the Israeli military stated it had fired at people launching mortar shells. B’Tselem’s inquiry found that no mortars were fired from that area, either at the time she was killed on in the preceding days.

fatalities.name: Maram Saleh Hassan Abu Isma'il
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by security guards at Qalandia Checkpoint after throwing a knife at security personnel stationed at the checkpoint from some 15 meters away. She posed no real danger to anyone at the time she was shot. Her 16-year-old brother who was with her was shot dead immediately afterwards. According to media reports, the investigation found that she was shot twice from behind, once in the back and once in the buttocks.

fatalities.name: Fadwa Ahmad Muhammad Abu Teir
fatalities.notes: Shot dead when she tried to stab Border Police officers on al-Wad (Ha-Gai) Street.

fatalities.name: Amani Hussni 'Abdallah Sabatin
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by soldiers at Gush Etzion Junction after she hit a military officer with her car and was suspected of perpetrating an attack. According to a statement by the IDF Spokesperson, the officer sustained light injuries.

fatalities.name: Kalzar Muhammad 'Abd al-Halim Muhammad 'Azmi al-'Awiwi
fatalities.notes: Shot dead at al-Awqaf (Tnuva) Checkpoint near the Tomb of the Patriarchs, after stabbing a Palestinian civilian. According to a statement by the IDF Spokesperson, no soldiers were injured in the incident.

fatalities.name: Mahdiyah Muhammad Ibrahim Hammad
fatalities.notes: Killed by Border Police gunfire while driving her car. According to a statement by the police, the shots were fired during an attempted vehicle attack. B’Tselem’s inquiry has called this contention into question as Hammad slowed her car down as she approached the officers.

fatalities.name: Maram Ramez 'Abed Hasunah
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by soldiers at Einav Checkpoint when she approached it, knife in hand.

fatalities.name: Samah 'Abd al-Mumin Ahmad 'Abdallah
fatalities.notes: Critically wounded by soldiers’ gunfire as while crossing she passed through a checkpoint in a car, with relatives. According to media reports, the gunfire was targeting a Palestinian youth who was had tried trying to stab Israelis at a nearby hitchhiking station. He, too, was killed. Died of her wounds at a hospital in Israel.

fatalities.name: Rasha Muhammad Hamed Rayan
fatalities.notes: Shot dead at HaPerot (the Fruit) Checkpoint by security guards from the Land Crossings Authority after drawing a knife and not heeding their calls to halt, when she was about 10 meters away from them.

fatalities.name: Tharwat Ibrahim Suliman a-Sha'rawi
fatalities.notes: Shot dead by soldiers standing on a road, after they suspected she was trying to run some of them over. The soldiers continued firing at her even after the car passed them.

fatalities.name: Nur Rasmi Muhammad Hassan
fatalities.notes: Killed along with her three-year-old daughter when their home was bombed.

fatalities.name: Hadil Salah a-Din Sadeq al-Hashlamun
fatalities.notes: Fatally wounded by soldiers’ gunfire at the Police (Shoter) Checkpoint, while carrying a concealed knife on her person. Soldiers called for her stop as she was on her way out of the checkpoint, fired at her legs, then immediately fired at her upper body. She died of her wounds later the same day.

fatalities.name: Farhanah Ibrahim Taleb al-'Attar
fatalities.notes: Killed when she returned to her home, which she had evacuated earlier, in order to take clothes.

fatalities.name: Rawyah Ibrahim Muhammad Judah
fatalities.notes: Killed with two of her daughters and two of her sons in the yard of their home in the Tel a-Za’tar neighborhood.

fatalities.name: Nisreen Ibrahim Isma'il Ahmad
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her seven-year-old son, a twin, in the bombing of an adjacent four-story building that had been evacuated. Her seven-year-old daughter was injured. A young woman who had returned to the evacuated building to pick up an item was also killed.

fatalities.name: Suhair 'Abd al-Karim Hamad Abu Madyan
fatalities.notes: Killed when she went to pick up an item from her apartment in a building that had been evacuated, and the building was then bombed. In an adjacent building, a mother and her seven-year-old son were killed, and the boy’s twin sister injured.

fatalities.name: Hayat 'Abd Rabo Suliman Abu Dahruj
fatalities.notes: Killed while asleep at home, when the nearby homes of her brother and nephew were bombed. Her nephew, his wife and their two children were also killed in the bombing.

fatalities.name: Huda Muhammad Khamis Abu Dahruj
fatalities.notes: Killed with her husband and two children when thier home and that of her father-in-law were bombed. Her husband’s aunt, who lived in a nearby home, was also killed.

fatalities.name: Amal Ibrahim Ahmad Yunes
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her husband and granddaughter in the bombing of the nearby home of the Kulab family. Four members of the family and three Hamas military branch operatives were killed in the Kulab home. A member of the ‘Aytah family, a woman, was killed in a nearby home. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

fatalities.name: Nazirah Ramadan Isma'il Kulab
fatalities.notes: Killed with three of her sons and three Hamas military branch operatives when her home was bombed. In nearby homes, three members of the Yunes family and a woman, a member of the ‘Aytah family, were killed as well. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

fatalities.name: 'Aishah Isma'il Hassan 'Atiyyah
fatalities.notes: Killed at home in the bombing of the nearby home of the Kulab family. Four members of the family and three Hamas military branch operatives were killed in the Kulab home. In a nearby home, three members of the Yunes family were killed as well. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

fatalities.name: Nabilah 'Eid Salamah a-Loh
fatalities.notes: Killed at home with her husband and three children. She was nine months pregnant. After she died, the fetus was delivered by C-section, but died later that day. In the neighboring home two of his brothers were killed. Another relative, a young woman, was also injured in another nearby home and later died of her injuries.

fatalities.name: Widad Mustafa Harb a-Deif
fatalities.notes: Wife of Muhammad a-Deif, head of the Hamas military branch. Killed with her two-year-old daughter and seven-month-old baby boy in their home the a-Sheikh Radwan neighborhood, Gaza City. Three neighbors, members of the a-Dalu family, one of them a minor and another a Hamas military branch operative, were also killed in the strike.

fatalities.name: Wafa Hussein Ahmad a-Dalu
fatalities.notes: Killed with her two sons, one of them a minor and the other a Hamas military branch operative, in their apartment in a building in the a-Sheikh Radwan neighborhood, Gaza City. Muhammad A-Deif, head of the Hamas military branch, also lived in that building. A-Deif’s wife and their two children, a two-year-old girl and a seven-month old baby boy, were also killed in the strike.

fatalities.name: Amani al-'Abed Mahmoud Barakah
fatalities.notes: Killed in her home.

fatalities.name: Karam Mahrus Hmeidan Khatab
fatalities.notes: Killed at the home of relatives. She had fled there from her Rafah home.

fatalities.name: Sumayah 'Abed Hamad Dheir
fatalities.notes: Killed at home.

fatalities.name: Ibtesam Ibrahim Muhammad al-Bakri
fatalities.notes: Killed together with five other members of her family in their home.

fatalities.name: Khitam Jum'ah Turban a-Shalalfeh
fatalities.notes: Killed in her home together with her husband, who was an operative in the armed wing of Hamas. Their son was injured and died about a month later of his injuries.

fatalities.name: Amani Fadel Salem Abu Jazar
fatalities.notes: Killed together with her daughter and son in their home.

fatalities.name: Najah Rajab Mahmoud a-Sharafi
fatalities.notes: Killed with her son and her husband's nephew while she was sitting in the yard of her home kneading dough.

fatalities.name: Nadiah Fawzi Hussein Abu Hamad
